markdownRemark.html:
Itâ€™s hard to believe my last blog post was in 2023. The AutoFL work I mentioned back then was (thankfully?) accepted to FSEâ€™24, and somewhere along the way it passed 100 citations (the LLM The LLM era moves fast ğŸ˜³). A lot has happened since then, so hereâ€™s a quick roundup of the biggest changes.

  1. I completed my PhD in August 2024

A long journey finally came to an end. Finishing it felt both relieving and oddly emotional, and Iâ€™m grateful for all the people who supported me along the way. And.. I still miss COINSE!

  1. I started a new job at Roku Seoul Office in June 2024

I met lots of amazing people there, and the industry experience taught me a lot, and many of those lessons continue to help even now.

  1. Since September 2025, Iâ€™ve been an Assistant Professor at Korea University

This was a big decision Iâ€™d been contemplating for years, and Iâ€™m glad I made the leap back into academia. Being able to do research again (and teaching!) has been deeply satisfying. Advising students has been refreshing and genuinely fun. Iâ€™m also thankful for everyone around me who has been incredibly supportive during this transition. ğŸ¥º

These days, I had been working on multiple topics including AutoCrashFL (essentially taking AutoFL ideas into real industrial crash debugging) and also exploring a few new research directions Iâ€™m excited about. Iâ€™m curious to see what kinds of work will come out over the next several years.

I also attended ASEâ€™25 in Seoul this year, my first in-person conference in a while. As a publicity co-chair, I was also the one behind the ASEâ€™25 Bluesky account ğŸ˜ The SE community in the post-LLM era feels very different from before. Itâ€™s exciting that we can now tackle problems that once seemed impossible, but at the same time, the technical â€œuniquenessâ€ of many approaches feels a bit blurred, so itâ€™s becoming more important to carefully examine what the real contribution actually is.

All in all, it has been a period full of change, both personally and academically. Maybe the next blog post will be in 2027â€¦ but hopefully Iâ€™ll have good news to share when it comes.
